about_app: Trees of Bavaria's forests - determine, discover, report. In times of worsening environmental degradation, the forest also suffers. Often we do not even know which trees are in our forest at all and which cultural-historical value these living beings have. With this app you can determine the trees of our homeland and get to know them better. Learn more about birch, beech, spruce and learn why it pays to do more to protect the forest.
terms_and_conditions: This version of trees in the forests of Bavaria is intended for demonstration and testing purposes, not for productive use. Should errors or damage occur during installation or use, no liability will be accepted.
Gerade noch 3000 Altbäume soll es in Deu: There are just 3000 old trees in Germany. Reasons for the sharp decline of the species are especially the loss of their habitat along the rivers as well as the cultivation of high-growth and competitive poplar hybrids. In 2006 the Black Poplar was elected Tree of the Year. This choice should not only draw attention to the species of tree itself, but also to the most threatened forest location in Central Europe - the softwood forest.
Der Begriff für unsere Buchstaben leitet: The term for our letters derives from beechwood sticks. They were "picked up" from the ground to interpret the runes carved on them. The Old High German 'buoh', a wooden writing board made of beech, is the namesake for our books. A tree specimen known throughout Germany was the Bavaria Beech. It stood near the district Pondorf the community Altmannstein in the Upper Bavarian district of Eichstätt in the natural park Altmühltal. Their age was estimated at 500 to 800 years, their trunk circumference was nine meters, the crown had a diameter of over 30 meters. Due to storm damage in the years 1995, 2006 and 2013, all main branches of the formerly hemispherical crown gradually broke. The wood remained as deadwood biotope on the spot.
Die Buche ist eine vergleichsweise risik: The beech is a comparatively low-risk tree species. Beech and beech mixed stands form stable forests and guarantee the forest owner a high operational and planning security. Young beeches are especially sensitive to late frosts. For mice and hoofed game, the seeds - the beechnuts - are special delicacies. Wild bite and peeling damage also occur on the beech. The bark of older beech trees often reacts to sunburn on sudden release. The beech complex disease is caused by the interaction of various factors. The beech also contains a number of insects such as the beech winder, the beech-tree weevil, beech tree beetle and the beech bark beetle. Even mushrooms infest the beech wood. Particularly important are white rot pathogens, such as the tinder sponge or the fire encrusting fungus, which decompose the wood.
Typische Buchenwaldbewohner sind Frühblü: Typical beech forest dwellers are early bloomers such as anemones, forest gypsophila, woodruff and onion leaf root. They use the light that can fall down to the forest floor in the uncultivated spring forest. A character bird of wooded forests is the black woodpecker. He chisels his breeding and sleeping caves into strong trunks. Hollow pigeon and Rauhfußkauz use these tree caves as 'Nachmieter'. Dead beech wood is an important habitat for many wood-dwelling beetle species.
Im Jahre 2008 haben Wissenschaftler in S: In 2008, scientists in Sweden discovered a spruce in the province of Dalarna, dating back to 9,550 years. It is the oldest living tree in the world. She survived even adverse climatic conditions because she was able to drive out new trunks from a rhizome.
Die Fichte ist als boreale Nadelbaumart: The spruce is a boreal conifer susceptible to heat and drought. Windfall danger threatens in pure stocks, especially in waterlogged and wet locations or if they grow up undifferentiated and unkempt close. In youth, it is vulnerable to late frosts on unprotected open spaces. Outside their optimum area, spruce stands are more threatened by insects and fungi.
Fichtenwälder bieten gut gedeckte und ge: Spruce forests provide well-sheltered and sheltered structures that many species of birds need for breeding and foraging. These include, for example, the Red Crossbill (Loxia curvirostra) or the Treecreeper (Certhia familiaris). In natural spruce forests, little light penetrates the forest floor. Therefore, it offers especially suitable plants, whose supply of photosynthesis is largely independent, a suitable biotope. Specially adapted to these conditions is the spruce asparagus (Monotropa hypopitys), which forms a symbiosis with the spruce.
Das Wort Birke ist auf einen Begriff im: The word birch is due to a term in Indo-European (* bherHg̑o) and means in reference to the light bark as much as "shiny, shimmering". The birch as a symbol of fertility used to be a helper in love needs. This purpose is almost forgotten today. Their branches, bark and leaves had to be used for all sorts of remedies and hopes of improvement in sexual needs.
Die beiden einheimischen, baumförmigen B: The two indigenous tree-shaped birch species, the sand birch (Betula pendula) and the peat birch (Betula pubescens) contribute significantly to the increase in biodiversity in our forests. It is generally known that our two birch species are among the most popular species of insects. More than 160 species of insects can be found on sandy and moor birches. The birches are thus among the willow species and the two oaks of the insects most used indigenous tree species. A beetle species specialized in the birch is e.g. the birch leaf scooter (Deporaus betulae, Rhynchitidae), which converts the front part of the leaf blade into an elaborate, bag-shaped "packet" into which he deposits his eggs. A striking specialized species is the Great Birch Tree wasp.
Die heimische Kiefer besitzt viele volks: The native pine has many popular names: Common pine, sandy or red pine, pine, Forche, Fuhr, Forle, Kienbaum, Waldföhre or Weißföhre. Etymologically, the term pine probably comes from the Middle High German word creation "Kien" for resinous wood and "Föhre".
Besonders in Reinbeständen ist die Waldk: Especially in pure stands, the Scots pine is strongly endangered by insects such as the nun, pine spinner, pine tree vein and Forleule. But also numerous mushroom types occur at the forest pine. In particular, the pine dump, hamburger or bubble rust can cause damage. Due to the broad crown shape and the long needles of the Scots pine, there are frequent crown breaks caused by wet snow.
Von den in Kiefernwäldern verbreiteten A: Of the species distributed in pine forests, 35 species are classified as pointer species for autochtone pine sites in Bavaria. They are absent in secondary (i.e., use-related) pine forests. Only a few species are strictly monophagous to tree species pine or bound exclusively to pine sites. However, if they are found in pine forests, a natural occurrence of the pine is assumed.
Die Lärche ist die einzige heimische Bau: The larch is the only native tree that throws off its needles in autumn. It is adapted to a continental climate with very cold winters and hot dry summers. It is largely frost resistant, storm proof and snowbreakproof.
Grundsätzlich ist die Lärche eine robust: Basically, the larch is a robust tree species. In locations with high humidity, however, it is susceptible to larch crab and various other needle fungi. Even bacteria can damage them outside their natural range and lead to growth deformations. The needles can be attacked by the larch miner moth. Weakened trees are therefore also endangered by larchbuck and larchbark beetle In plantings with larch, the brown weevil poses a potential risk. Young larch trees are happily used by roebuck.
Keine einheimische Baumart ist besser in: No native tree species is better able to grow on wet sites than the black alder.
Vor allem die Inhaltsstoffe schränken di: Above all, the ingredients severely limit the insect fauna on the walnut. From Germany so far no phytophagous beetles or butterfly caterpillars on the leaves of walnut are known. In the wood, although the blue screen and the willow drill are occasionally observed, bark beetles or fresh wood settlers do not occur on walnuts. On the leaves, some fungal pathogens cause leaf spots that affect the trees only slightly. An infestation of the fruits, however, can lead to the loss of the harvest. Although many old walnut trees in the heartwood sometimes show massive rots, the number of previously observed wood fungi on the walnut is still very low. Pests from seedling to root pathogens can already attack the seedlings. These include species from the genus Phytophthora as well as species of higher fungi from the genera Rhizoctonia and Rosellinia (Brandenburger 1985).
Unsere Vorfahren zählten den Bergahorn z: Our ancestors counted the sycamore maple as the 'serene' trees. He stood among other things for peace, serenity and harmony. Maple wood sills provided protection against witches and wizards. For the Celts the white wood symbolized a special inner purity. In the Greeks, the sycamore was dedicated to the god of war Ares. The botanical genus name Acer is Latin and means sharp, sharp. The word refers to the pointed leaves. The sycamore map used to produce sugar, as did the American sugar maple. Economic importance was given to the maple syrup especially in times of need and war. 100 liters of tree juice were needed to win about one kilogram of sugar. It had to be done very carefully to prevent bleeding of the tree.
Vor allem im Jugendstadium treten Gefähr: Especially in the youth stage, hazards occur. In addition to a moderate late frost risk game bite is the most important hazard factor. Feeding and peeling damage also cause problems for the sycamore maple. On grazing areas, the young plants often suffer from mouse feeding.
Bergahorne sind Lebensraum für viele Vog: Sycamore are a habitat for many species of birds, insects, fungi and mistletoes. Especially aphids like the tree because of its high sugar content, and accordingly the ants that milk the aphids. Birds and mice also occasionally scratch the bark to get the sugary spring juice. The seeds are eaten by numerous animals.
Die Eberesche ist von alters her in Kult: The mountain ash has been in culture since ancient times. From the fruits, it is best to produce marmalades, compotes and brandies, preferably after the action of frost, which causes the breakdown of the parasorbic acid. Because of the high vitamin C content, cooked rowan berries are very healthy and were previously used against scurvy. Leaves and flowers are used in medicine for cough, bronchitis, rheumatism and gout. Hard, polishable wood is increasingly being used in the furniture industry.
Das Gehölz ist eine Schmetterlingsfutter: The wood is a butterfly feed plant and serves many other insects as a food plant. Many species of birds, foxes, badgers and rodents eat the fruits.
Der finstere und gefürchtete Wald vieler: The dark and dreaded forest of many fairy tales and legends is inseparable from the fir tree. It is not without reason that this is the connection between the native silver fir and beech, which is one of the most shade-tolerant tree species.
Die größte Gefährdung geht von zu hohen: The biggest threat is from too high roe deer, red and chamois stocks. Compared to harmful organisms such as fungi or insects, the silver fir is robust. There are some bark beetles specialized in fir, but large scale damage is rare. The infestation of silver fir with stem or instinctual lice can be dangerous. Similarly, there is a risk of late frost and freeze-throats in the fir. The fir is more susceptible to air pollutants, especially sulfur compounds, than other tree species. However, with the improvement of the air purity of the past decades, the burdens have decreased.
Die Weißtanne spielt aus tierökologische: The silver fir plays a special role among the coniferous trees from the point of view of animal ecology. With its wide ecological amplitude, it offers species with preference for conifers habitats in various forest communities.
Die Esche spielte vor allem bei den Nord: The ash played a big role, especially among the northern Germans. They worshiped her as the World Tree Yggdrasil, whose three roots linked the gods, the underworld, and the land of the giants. At these roots sat the three Norns, the goddesses of fate, who determined the lot of men. Already in antiquity the production of remedies from the ash was known. Since the Middle Ages, knowledge of naturopathy has spread to modern times through the spread of botanical knowledge. Today, extracts of the ash bark, combined with other herbal ingredients, are primarily used for rheumatic diseases and mild chronic pain. The ash bark has an anti-inflammatory, slightly fever-reducing and mild pain relieving effect. The ash is a climate-tolerant and therefore important tree species in the climate-induced forest conversion. However, it is endangered by the ascendancy in their existence and cultivation is currently not without risk.
Als frostempfindliche Art ist die Esche: As a frost-sensitive species, the ash is prone to late frosts (April, May), but usually heals them well. Damage caused by wet snow pressure can play a role in the older thickening phase. In case of excessive wildlife, biting and damaging damage with the loss of the leading shoots leads to unfavorable and value-reducing growth forms. Extremely excessive game densities lead to the far-reaching failure of young plants outside of game protection fences. In particular on grassy areas, damage from mouse feeding may occur in the lower stem area of the young.
Die Esche ist ein Bestandteil der Hartho: The ash tree is a part of the hardwood forests, which provide a habitat for numerous creatures. There are about 400 species of butterflies, which are mainly dusk and nocturnal, numerous species of dragonfly and about 1,000 species of beetles. Amphibians, reptiles, birds and individual mammals feel well in the riparian forests.
Sie zählt zu den wertvollsten Holzarten: It is one of the most valuable types of wood in our forests. Particularly famous are the Spessarteichen. When these trees are harvested as veneer logs from about 240 years of age, they have reached heights of up to 40 meters. Freestanding oak trees are often gnarled trees with a thick, short trunk and a wide-spreading crown. Such trees often reach a high age of several hundred years.
Dank ihres tief reichenden Wurzelwerks s: Thanks to their deep root system, oak trees are particularly storm-proof, stable and well equipped for longer dry periods. A special role is played by the leaf-eating caterpillars of the butterflies such as sponges, frostbites or oak processionary moths. However, the oaks have adapted to this extent so that they can compensate for feeding damage of spring by the Johannistrieb at the end of June again. Frequent feeding events in successive years or simultaneous feeding of various pests can overwhelm this regeneration capacity. Then control measures will be necessary. Especially in the warm regions, in recent years the oak processionary moth is causing concern to forest conservationists when the poisonous caterpillar hairs affect the health of forest visitors.
Eine herausragende Rolle spielen die Eic: The oak groves play a prominent role in terms of the number of species of plants and animals, because they are particularly rich in light and heat-requiring species due to their lighter crowns. For example, of the large butterflies, there are 179 species of oak, but only 28 species of spruce, and of the wood-colonizing beetles 900 species of oak and only 300 species of spruce. Also, the hermit, an extremely rare species of beetle, develops in so-called Mulmhöhlen, as they have, for example, old knotty oaks. Other tree cave-dwelling "subtenants" such as middle-woodpeckers, collared flycatchers and bats find in oak forests permanent habitats. Oak forests on special sites such as nutrient-poor, dry sandy soils, on dry-warm silicate rock sites, on sunny clayey pelosols and flat-yielding ripeness are particularly significant. Some of these special forests are subject to the special legal protection of Paragraph 30 BNatschG in conjunction with Art. 23 BayNatschG.
Heimische Eschen werden durch den Pilz H: Domestic ash trees are currently being massively affected in their distribution and development by the fungus Hymenoscyphus pseudoalbidus. The perpetrator of the ash shoot death, also called "false white stem cup", has meanwhile established itself in 22 countries in Northern, Eastern and Central Europe and is also found throughout Bavaria in the ash stands.
äußere, den Stamm, die Äste und Wurzeln: outer, solid, often hard, barky layer surrounding the trunk, branches and roots
